channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Libraries and museums get federal funding back after Trump cuts
item.description: Earlier this year, the Trump administration gutted the Institute of Museum and Library Services, leading to canceled federal grants. Now, after a court order, those grants are being reinstated.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, the Trump administration gutted the Institute of Museum and Library Services, leading to canceled federal grants. Now, after a court order, those grants are being reinstated.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: You read that white: Pantone's 2026 Color of the Year is 'Cloud Dancer'
item.description: This is the first time Pantone has chosen a shade of white. The company says it's "a lofty white that serves as a symbol of calming influence in a society rediscovering the value of quiet reflection."
item.content:encoded: This is the first time Pantone has chosen a shade of white. The company says it's "a lofty white that serves as a symbol of calming influence in a society rediscovering the value of quiet reflection."
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: How old is your music taste? Spotify will tell you, though you may not like it
item.description: Spotify Wrapped is bluntly telling users their "listening age," which in many cases is several decades older or younger than their actual age. It's a calculated strategy.
item.content:encoded: Spotify Wrapped is bluntly telling users their "listening age," which in many cases is several decades older or younger than their actual age. It's a calculated strategy.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: George Clooney's kids don't care about his success (and that's a good thing)
item.description: In Jay Kelly, Clooney plays an emotionally stunted movie star struggling with work and family life. He can relate: "We're all balancing it. We're never getting it perfect."
item.content:encoded:
In Jay Kelly, Clooney plays an emotionally stunted movie star struggling with work and family life. He can relate: "We're all balancing it. We're never getting it perfect."

(Image credit: Peter Mountain)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Vern Yip's secret to better home decor? Stop scrolling for inspiration
item.description: In the digital age, it's easy to curate the look of your home with the help of artificial intelligence and social media. But designer Vern Yip would like you to take a more hands-on, tactile approach.
item.content:encoded:
In the digital age, it's easy to curate the look of your home with the help of artificial intelligence and social media. But designer Vern Yip would like you to take a more hands-on, tactile approach.

(Image credit: Kameron Jennings)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Lucy Liu challenges mental health taboos in 'Rosemead'
item.description: In Rosemead, Lucy Liu plays the role of an ailing mother who takes drastic measures to try to protect her troubled teenage son from himself. Liu also produced the film, based on a true story.
item.content:encoded:
Rosemead.'/>

In Rosemead, Lucy Liu plays the role of an ailing mother who takes drastic measures to try to protect her troubled teenage son from himself. Liu also produced the film, based on a true story.

(Image credit: Lyle Vincent)
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Filmmaker Jafar Panahi is sentenced again in Iran as Hollywood's awards season starts
item.description: Panahi's latest film, It Was Just an Accident, won three Gotham Awards on Monday. The filmmaker has been imprisoned in Iran before — but continues to make movies.
item.content:encoded:
Panahi's latest film, It Was Just an Accident, won three Gotham Awards on Monday. The filmmaker has been imprisoned in Iran before — but continues to make movies.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola)
item.dc:creator: Alina Edwards

item.title: In the aftermath of tragedy, a customer helped a woman who fainted at her new job
item.description: In the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, Emily Vinson started a new job at a pizza place. She fainted on her first day — and a customer came to the rescue.
item.content:encoded: In the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, Emily Vinson started a new job at a pizza place. She fainted on her first day — and a customer came to the rescue.

item.title: Check your cheese: Shredded and grated varieties are recalled nationwide
item.description: The FDA is urging customers to toss certain brands of grated Pecorino Romano; at the same time, it escalated an existing recall of numerous shredded cheeses.
item.content:encoded:
The FDA is urging customers to toss certain brands of grated Pecorino Romano; at the same time, it escalated an existing recall of numerous shredded cheeses.

(Image credit: Roberto Machado Noa)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Here are 8 novels NPR staff and critics loved in 2025
item.description: Every year, we ask NPR staff and book critics to share their favorite titles in our annual Books We Love guide. Here are 8 fiction picks that were standout stars.
item.content:encoded: Every year, we ask NPR staff and book critics to share their favorite titles in our annual Books We Love guide. Here are 8 fiction picks that were standout stars.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck
